intro: Muscari filiforme, commonly known as the slender grape hyacinth, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Muscari filiforme thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
